paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene variant V30M, its penetrance, and the clinical implications for carriers.

patients.demographics: 66 subjects including 25 healthy controls, 14 asymptomatic carriers, and 27 symptomatic patients

functional_data.summary: The study indicates that asymptomatic carriers may exhibit subclinical gait changes.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical presentation and gait analysis.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of early detection and monitoring of gait changes in carriers.
key_quotes: Hereditary amyloidosis associated with transthyretin V30M (ATTRv V30M) is a rare and inherited multisystemic disease.
The asymptomatic carriers showed normal neurological examination and no alteration of the QST, NCS, heart rate deep breathing and SSR.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the TTR V30M variant.
